column1: Kizilyurt (Russian: Кизилю́рт; Kumyk: Чир-юрт/Къызылюрт) is a town in the Republic of Dagestan
column3: about 53 kilometers (33 mi) northwest of Makhachkala. Population: 32
column6: 682 (1989 Census).. It is located where the north-flowing Sulak River leaves the mountains and enters the Terek-Sulak Lowland.

column1: It was founded in 1963 by merging the work settlements of Kizilyurt
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Kizilyurt serves as the administrative center of Kizilyurtovsky District
column3: even though it is not a part of it. As an administrative division
column5: together with two settlements of urban type (Bavtugay and Novy Sulak) and one rural locality (the selo of Stary Bavtugay)
column6: incorporated separately as the Town of Kizilyurt—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column7: the Town of Kizilyurt is incorporated as Kizilyurt Urban Okrug.

column1: Ethnic groups in the city administrative area (2002 census):
Chechens (1.0%)Ethnic groups in the city itself (2002 census):
Kizilyurt has a humid continental climate (Köppen climate classification: Dfa).
